    jdl 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT API

    Packages
    Package
    Description
    net.tvburger.jdl
    Welcome to Java Deep Learning!
    net.tvburger.jdl.adaline
    Provides the implementation of Bernard Widrow and Ted Hoff's ADALINE (1960)
    net.tvburger.jdl.common
    Contains classes that are common (can be used well outside the scope of machine learning / AI)
    net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns
    This package defines annotations for design patterns to help understand the design and function of classes
    net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils
    Contains simple classes that are not present in the standard java library
    net.tvburger.jdl.datasets
    Package to obtain data sets to be used with estimation functions
    net.tvburger.jdl.knn
    Provides the implementation of k-Nearest Neighbors
    net.tvburger.jdl.mlp
    Implementation of the MultiLayer Perceptron [WIP]
    net.tvburger.jdl.model
    Defines the concepts for estimation functions
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.distances
    Package for distance metrics
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn
    Defines the neural network as specialization of an estimation function
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.initializers
    Defines the neural network initialization algorithms
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.optimizers
    Contains the neural network optimizer algorithms
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.regularizers
     
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars
    Defines scalar functions
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations
    Implements the different activation functions for neurons
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.training
    Defines the concepts related for training an estimation function
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss
    Provides the different loss functions used for training
    net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes
    Provides the different regimes for training
    net.tvburger.jdl.perceptron
    Provides the implementation of Frank Rosenblatt's Perceptron (1958)
